meanings.definition: Change or turn into something different
meanings.sent1: She will convert the old shed into a cozy playhouse for the kids.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar will convert into a beautiful butterfly.
meanings.sent3: I tried to convert my messy room into a neat and tidy space, but it's still a mess!
meanings.sent4: His kindness can convert even the coldest hearts.
meanings.sent5: The magic wand can convert ordinary objects into gold.

meanings.definition: Cause to change in form, character, or function
meanings.sent1: The new software will convert the files to a different format.
meanings.sent2: The storm's strong winds can convert a calm sea into rough waves.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally hit the wrong button and converted the text into gibberish.
meanings.sent4: Her smile can convert a gloomy day into a bright one.
meanings.sent5: The potion has the power to convert a frog into a prince.

meanings.definition: Adopt a different belief or religion
meanings.sent1: After much thought, she decided to convert to Buddhism.
meanings.sent2: He converted to vegetarianism after learning about animal welfare.
meanings.sent3: I jokingly told my friend I would convert to being a morning person, but I love sleeping in too much.
meanings.sent4: Her trip to India made her convert to a more spiritual way of life.
meanings.sent5: The book inspired him to convert to a more positive mindset.

meanings.definition: Make a change in units, form, or expression
meanings.sent1: You need to convert the measurements from inches to centimeters.
meanings.sent2: The translator will convert the text from English to Spanish.
meanings.sent3: I had to convert my speech from a formal tone to a more casual one for the kids to understand.
meanings.sent4: Her art can convert ordinary objects into extraordinary masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: The teacher helped the students convert their ideas into a cohesive story.
